title: AsILayHodling
author: AsILayHodling
content: Hey everybody, Luxor Technologies just released its custom firmware for the S19j Pro and S19 XP (more S19 series to come):https://luxor.tech/firmwareMore info here in the documentation:https://docs.firmware.luxor.tech/introCurious to hear everyone's thoughts!

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: AsILayHodling on March 15, 2023, 06:05:14 PMHey everybody, Luxor Technologies just released its custom firmware for the S19j Pro and S19 XP (more S19 series to come):https : // luxor. tech / firmwareMore info here in the documentation:https : // docs. firmware. luxor. tech / introCurious to hear everyone's thoughts!they claim 111th and 1149 watts for the firmware.seems too good to be true.If I had firmware that made a 100th j pro go from 100th and 2900 watts to 111th and 1149 watts I would be looking to do a private sale for a few million dollars.So I simple do not  think they are good.note I disabled links

comments.author: MrMik
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on March 15, 2023, 07:26:46 PMthey claim 111th and 1149 watts for the firmware.seems too good to be true.If I had firmware that made a 100th j pro go from 100th and 2900 watts to 111th and 1149 watts I would be looking to do a private sale for a few million dollars.So I simple do not  think they are good.note I disabled linksI could not find where the claim is.Could it be that they claim a maximum of 111TH/s and a minimum of 1149W, but of course not both at the same time?

comments.author: Andartis
comments.body: I am wondering why I can not find any comparison between this and other custom FW.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: philipma1957 on March 15, 2023, 07:26:46 PMIf I had firmware that made a 100th j pro go from 100th and 2900 watts to 111th and 1149 watts I would be looking to do a private sale for a few million dollars.So I simple do not  think they are good.note I disabled linksI read the docs, it could be another distribution of Vnish and not something made from scratch?, they also charge 2.8% fees which is the exact same fee charged by Vnish on the S19 models, let us see how things unfold for them and whether or not they are going to comply with GPL license given that Luxor is pretty much a large company that sits on a ton of hashrate.
